name: Swiftys: Cheaper By The Dozen Quiz | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.  

QUESTION ONE: "We can't have this and eat it too," said Marie Antoinette ___.
questions.explanation:
Archaically.

	The phrase allegedly made famous by Marie Antoinette was "Let them eat cake"...Our Cake.

questions.text: "It's between my sole and my heel," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Archly.

	The area of your foot between the heel and sole is the arch.

questions.text: "That little demon didn't tell the truth," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Implied.

	Little demon = Imp, didn't tell the truth = Lied.

questions.text: "I'd like some Chinese food," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Wantonly.

	Won Tons are a Chinese dish.

Wolfishly.

	Salmon that wear sweaters (jumpers) would be wool fish.

questions.text: "This looks like the fruit of the blackthorn," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Slowly.

	Sloe is the fruit of the blackthorn.

questions.text: "These are the propulsion systems used by NASA for the moonshots," said Tom ___.

questions.explanation:
Moped.

	A Mo-Ped is a motorized bike.
